result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez

defendant.name: Hernandez, Ignacio Guitierrez

records.addlTxt:
OFF RECORD/ 10:28 AM Defendant Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Pollak requests a new date. Court schedules Status Conference. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

10:55 AM Defendant Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty acknowledged receipt of information.  Through Counsel, DEF entered NG plea.  Attny Pollak request status, State no objection.   Bond Continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:40 AM Defendant Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez appeared by video from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   State request court take Judicial notice of bond in  Sawyer County Case 21CF257.  Attny Pollak no objection.  Court takes judicial notice of bond.   Attny Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, LCO Officer Leverton appears by video by zoom. Court sworn in Officer.   State begins examination.   11:49 AM  Witness identified the DEF, Court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.   11:50 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.  11:53 AM Attny Pollak no further questions.  11:53 AM  Witness excused from zoom.   No further witness by either party.  State request for bind over.  Attny Pollak no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

Attny Pollak filed motion for bond modification, and makes argument.  State objects bond modification.  Court makes statement.  Court denies bond motion.
Arraignment scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

8:42 AM Defendant Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez in court.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Ignacio Guitierrez Hernandez. 

Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  Court recites the charges and the penalties. Court enters not guilty pleas on the misdemeanor. Atty Pollak requests for the Court sets preliminary hearing within 10 days. Bond continues.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:03AM DE Ignacio Hernandez in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty  Gabriel Pollack (special appearance) in court. Bruce R Poquette appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond. Court sets bond. CBS $1500 ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia. No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for August 16th, 2022 at 8:30AM.
Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
